arguments.description:
XforJ combines the elegance of javascript and the power of XSL elements to produce compiled javascript templates. You compose templates in a hybird grammar and compile that down to javascript.\n
Visit http://www.xforj.com for more info.
arguments.title: XforJ A Javascript Template Compiler

argument.name: --output-file
argument.description: The file where the compiled template will be placed.

argument.name: --minify-html
argument.description: When enabled, space is removed before and after all '<>'.

argument.name: --assign-to-global
argument.description: When enabled, all templates are assigned to the global object. When disabled, a new object if returned from the entire XforJ program. In this scenario, a mechanism such as eval must be used to capture the returned object to gain access to the defined templates.

argument.name: --strip-new-lines
argument.description: Replace all new line characters with ''.
